page.title: 12East Hagbourne- Ghosts
page.content: Some people still believe that ghosts may be seen in East Hagbourne, on New Years Eve. Indeed it has been claimed that a headless horseman has been seen on at least two separate occasions riding through the village. No one seems very sure how the story started. Some say that it dates from the time Cromwell quartered 6000 horsemen here in 1644 but some say it comes from the grave, opened in 1803, of a British chief buried in 55 BC with his horses and chariot. If you run round the King's Carpenters grave 4 times at midnight, you will see ghosts holding hands and dancing round the church! The carpenter in question was Thomass Phillips, carpenter to Kings George I & II, who died 14th August 1736 at the age of 47. His son, who died on 14th May 1736, age 6, is buried with him.
